result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. CAREY P FORSYTH

records.addlTxt:
8:43 AM Defendant CAREY P FORSYTH in court.  Prosecuting attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Unknown if time sat on probation hold will count towards jail time requested. Defendant asks for time to seek out counsel to help resolve issue.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:12 PM Defendant CAREY P FORSYTH appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for PD services. Defendant would like to waive his right to an attorney. Court accepts waiver. State recites offer. Defendant would like to accept offer. Remarks by Defendant.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 08:45 am.

1:06 PM Defendant CAREY P FORSYTH appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Carly Jo Foor Ms. in court for CAREY P FORSYTH.  Prosecuting attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for PD services but is awaiting appointment. State asks for $500 cash bond with conditions. Remarks by Victim.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
